title: I was diagnosed with skin cancer at just 33 ‚Äì here‚Äôs five signs to look out for and my advice on checking your skin
creator: Jodie McCormack
content: AN outdoor worker has issued a major warning after being diagnosed with skin cancer at just 33 years old. Paul revealed he received the melanoma diagnosis after noticing a freckle on his ear had changed. The Donegal man teamed up with the HSE to share his story and urge people to be vigilant for skin cancer symptoms . He stressed the importance of knowing what your skin usually looks like so you can identify any changes . In a video from the HSE as part of their SunSmart campaign, Paul shared his diagnosis story saying: "I was diagnosed with having a melanoma skin cancer on my ear at the age of 33. "In December 2023 I noticed a freckle had slightly changed on my ear and it turned into a wee brown spot. "I passed no heed as I was back boxing at the time and I thought maybe I just got hit on the ear." However, Paul revealed when the spot was still there after a few months a friend questioned him and warned it could be melanoma. The friend told Paul: "You know that's not good if something appears like that it could be a melanoma." After doing some research following the friend's warning Paul made an appointment with his doctor to get it checked. The doctor told Paul the signs they would look for are shape, size, colour, pattern and colour and all were present. Paul had been working outdoors since he was 16 and admitted he had not been protecting his skin over the years. 0utdoor workers are exposed to two to three times more UV rays than people who work indoors. Figures from the...

title: What Time Are the 2024 Emmys? Here‚Äôs When the Awards Show Starts and More
creator: Vivian
content: After the delayed 2023 Emmys ceremony in January, the 76th Annual Primetime Emmy Awards are back and set for Sunday. Hollywood will celebrate the best in television that aired between June 2023 and May 2024, with the awards show hosted by legendary comedy actor Eugene Levy and his actor-producer son, Dan Levy . Find out everything you need to know about the 2024 Emmy Awards ‚Äî including event start times, who‚Äôs nominated, and more ‚Äî below. What Time Are the 2024 Emmys? Television‚Äôs biggest event will air on Sunday night at 8 p.m. ET (5 p.m. Pacific), two hours after the red carpet festivities begin. The Emmys typically run on schedule and conclude in about three hours. Where Can I Watch the 2024 Emmys? ABC is broadcasting the ceremony live from the Peacock Theater in downtown Los Angeles, with streaming available on Hulu the following day. The event can also be streamed live on PEOPLE and EW ‚Äòs websites, as well as on several social platforms, including YouTube, TikTok, X, Instagram, Facebook, and The Roku Channel. When Is the Red Carpet for the 2024 Emmys? The cable network E! will air a red carpet show starting at 6 p.m. Eastern, hosted by Laverne Cox , comedian Heather McMahan , and E! host Keltie Knight . The show will stream live on E! and on the outlet‚Äôs social media accounts, including YouTube and Instagram . E! title: Transcript: David Becker and Chris Krebs on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 15, 2024
content: The following is a transcript of an interview with David Becker, Center of Election Innovation and Research executive director and CBS contributor, and Chris Krebs, former director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency and CBS News cybersecurity expert and analyst on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 15, 2024. MARGARET BRENNAN: For more on the upcoming election and the efforts underway to secure the vote, we turn to David Becker. He's a former civil rights attorney at the Department of Justice who now leads the center of election innovation and research. He's also a CBS contributor on election law. And Chris Krebs, the former director of the cybersecurity and infrastructure security agency, now an expert and analyst here at CBS Good to have you both. David, let me start with you. We saw this letter this past week from Secretaries of State in all fifty states and District of Columbia, issuing concern that we could see voters disenfranchised because of this increase in mail returned as undeliverable at higher than usual rates, even in cases where a voter is known not to have moved. And Donald Trump was tweeting about this this morning, you can't trust the Postal Service. How much of a problem is this going to be for mail in voting? DAVID BECKER: Well, it's a potential problem. I'm hearing this from- from state officials and local officials, of course, there in the States, and we are seeing mail voting spread as an option around the...

creator: GOBankingRates
content: Anyone who tells you that navigating the complexity of the current financial landscape is easy or that there is just one path to take may not have an investment philosophy worth following. While no single method or service fits all in the United States, understanding different approaches can help you make informed decisions that align with your short-term and long-term financial objectives. Whether you‚Äôre a novice when it comes to Wall Street or just want to see your assets managed more profitably, there is, in fact, a different approach for different folks. From risk management to sustainable investing, experts like Warren Buffett, Mark Cuban and Tony Robbins recommend a variety of strategies, products and services that cater to a broad range of needs. Here are four that stand out. Earning passive income doesn't need to be difficult. According to Buffett, forming positive money habits is the first step to accomplishing more successful and traditional wealth management strategies. In 2007, at the University of Florida, he said, ‚ÄúMost behavior is habitual, and they say that the chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.‚Äù This approach to financial planning involves developing a broad, personalized strategy encompassing various aspects of personal finance, including investments, estate planning, tax management and retirement planning. content: Finding the right place to live out your years isn‚Äôt easy. There‚Äôs a lot to consider, such as the cost of living, access to healthcare and taxes. If you plan to buy a new home or already own one, compare property tax rates. You‚Äôll find that your money stretches farther in some states than others. Another factor is access to healthcare. If you have a medical condition, look for a location that provides the treatment you need. As you age, you may need additional medical care, including assisted living or nursing home services. Costs for healthcare needs may differ significantly from state to state. title: Tears as Shelter Dog's Day Out With Volunteer Ends‚ÄîBut a Surprise Awaits
content: The internet was brought to tears by a rescue dog's sad face upon returning to an animal shelter‚Äîbut she had no idea that there was a big surprise in store. The dog, named Franny, was in the shelter for over four months, spending the last two in quarantine with heartworm. Danielle Baughman, who volunteers at the shelter in New Kensington, Pennsylvania, told that she would go and sit with her every day for company, but Franny "would get very sad" when that was over, and she had to go back to being alone. When the quarantine was over, Franny got to spend the day out with another volunteer, named Lindsey, but she was devastated to return to the shelter afterwards. She couldn't get excited about the prospect of being cooped up in a crate, and as the car pulled up to Animal Protectors of Allegheny Valley, her demeanor changed instantly. "She is a wonderful dog, so a volunteer jumped at the chance to take her on a doggie day out and took Franny to her son's baseball practice and then a pool party," Baughman said. "When they pulled into the shelter, Franny's head hung so low. The volunteer cried all night thinking about how sad she was." After Franny left such a lasting mark, Lindsey didn't waste time before returning again the following day to see her again. She took Franny home for a sleepover, and she was "so well behaved and perfect," that Lindsey knew she'd found . "She took her back to the shelter and recorded her pulling in. Franny's head hung low again because she didn't...

title: Fall equinox 2024: When it is, why it happens and what to look for
content: While meteorologists like to call fall at the beginning of September, astronomical autumn starts later, on the autumnal equinox . This year, it falls on Sunday, Sept. 22 at 8:44 a.m. EDT (12:44 UTC), according to the National Weather Service . At this specific time, Earth's axis is tilted side-on to the sun, meaning there's an almost equal amount of sunlight and darkness across the globe. This celestial geometry marks the changing of the seasons ‚Äî from summer to autumn in the Northern Hemisphere and from winter to spring in the Southern Hemisphere. The word "equinox" is Latin for "equal night," one of two days per year when the lengths of daylight and darkness are the same across the globe. The fall equinox is an important way to mark Earth's annual journey around the sun. The hours of darkness will gradually increase north of the equator until the solstice on Dec. 21, and vice versa south of the equator. Related: 'Potentially hazardous' asteroid the size of a skyscraper to skim past Earth on Tuesday More hours of night also mean more hours for stargazing; some of the year's best meteor showers are yet to come , and the next three full moons, including the Harvest Moon on Sept. 17 , will be supermoons ‚Äî making them appear bigger and brighter in the sky. If you don't have a good pair of stargazing binoculars or a nice backyard telescope , now's a great time to invest in one. The equinoxes and solstices result from Earth's axis, which is tilted by 23.5 degrees, meaning...

title: Why it takes more than the fed to keep US out of recession
creator: Yahoo Finance Video
content: After spending 40 years on Wall Street and serving at the former Wells Fargo chief investment strategist, knows a thing or two about how the economy moves. Paulsen joined Yahoo Finance‚Äôs on Opening Bid to break down why the US economy has path's to success outside of the Fed's impact. "Fiscal policy is sort of a life on its own if the economy slows deficit spending goes up automatically and vice versa," he explained. For full episodes of Opening Bid, on our website or on your favorite podcast platform. Video Transcript So we've got a lot of easing in the pipeline that's outside of the Fed's purview or control if you will. And I think that easing is going to keep us out of a recession, even though the Fed is tardy. I think there is too much focus on the, on the Fed. The fact of the matter is you and me manage the growth in the money supply, you and me manage the level of bond yields. We manage the, the level of where the dollar is going to settle in and actually fiscal policy is sort of a life on its own if the economy slows deficit spending goes up automatically and vice versa. So while, while the Fed has regular meetings and television, uh press conferences, the the free market Laissez Faire policy officials don't do that, but they do act and I think they've been easing now for a fair period of time and with a lag of about 6 to 6 months to a year, those policies are going to start to improve economic growth again as we look forward to the next year.

title: BarceloÃÅ Fortina has 'probably the best view' on Europe's sunniest island
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Phoebe Jobling)
content: Vibe Step out onto the balcony and you‚Äôll be met with a serene blue sea and a panoramic view of Valletta ‚Äì Malta‚Äôs capital ‚Äì from most of the 183 rooms at BarceloÃÅ Fortina Malta . The contemporary hotel, which first opened its doors in 1966, recently underwent a ¬£30million transformation and is now part of the prestigious BarceloÃÅ Hotel Group. It aims to give guests the luxury five-star experience and quality you‚Äôd expect, but with an added touch of Maltese authenticity. Set on Sliema‚Äôs south-facing seafront, you‚Äôre unlikely to find accommodation in a better spot on this part of the Mediterranean island, with a 3.75-mile promenade, TigneÃÅ Point Beach and an array of shops, bars and restaurants just a stone‚Äôs throw away. Malta is the sunniest country in Europe , basking in more than 300 days of sunshine a year, with temperatures hitting highs of around 32¬∞C in July and dropping to a pleasant 17¬∞C in December. Style Expect sunrays to beam through the floor-to-ceiling windows of your spacious room pretty much every day, filling every corner with natural light. You‚Äôll be consistently wowed by the hotel‚Äôs luxurious ambience, from its sleek room design to its carefully thought-out details and ethical extras. What‚Äôs more, the Barcelo group is renowned for its comfy king-sized beds, so you‚Äôre almost guaranteed an unrivalled night‚Äôs sleep. You‚Äôd be forgiven for not wanting to leave the grounds, given all the impressive amenities. Grab a cocktail in Lido Beach Club, often accompanied...

title: US Coast Guard plucks stranded boater from the high seas in dramatic video
creator: Jorge Fitz-Gibbon
content: Dramatic video captures the moment a US Coast Guard chopper lifts a man stuck on a sinking boat to safety about 40 miles off the coast of Florida. The newly released footage shows a guardsman being lowered into the Gulf of Mexico from a Coast Guard helicopter around 2 p.m. Saturday far off the coast of Crystal River, according to a release . The chopper and a plane were sent out of the Coast Guard station in Clearwater after getting a distress call about a boater in a ‚Äúpartially submerged vessel,‚Äù the release said. The boat was taking in water through a crack in the hull, according to the agency. A rescue crew located the stranded boater and hoisted him to safety, the footage shows, with no serious injuries reported in the incident. ‚ÄúThe distressed boater did an outstanding job by wearing his lf8ie jacked and having a marine-grade radio on board his vessel,‚Äù Coast Guard Lt. Casey Skomer said in a statement. ‚ÄúThese items contributed to him being rescued swiftly and safely.‚Äù The boater was not identified. Last week, another Coast Guard rescue squad evacuated an injured crew member from an oil tanker off the coast of Texas and delivered him to a Galveston hospital, where he is in stable condition. Earlier in the month, the Clearwater station reported that a couple was rescued off the Florida coast after their 26-foot boat capsized 18 miles out into the Gulf.

title: At least 40 people are missing after a boat capsizes in Nigeria, authorities say
creator: The Canadian Press
content: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) ‚Äî At least 40 people have drowned in a boat accident on a river in northwest Nigeria, said President Bola Tinubu on Sunday. The accident happened in Zamfara state, as farmers were trying to get to their land, said Tinubu in a statement. The president promised support for the victims and directed emergency agencies to assess the incident. Yazid Abubakar, a police spokesperson in Zamfara, told The Associated Press the accident happened on Saturday and that five people were rescued, but 40 are still missing. It was not immediately clear how many people were on the boat when it went down. The Associated Press

title: Vance doesn't back away from false claims about migrants in Ohio even amid threats to the community
content: WASHINGTON -- Republican vice presidential candidate JD Vance did not back away on Sunday from the false claims he and Donald Trump have been making that Haitians in an Ohio community are abducting and eating pets, even as the state's GOP governor and other officials insist there is no evidence of such behavior. Vance, an Ohio senator, said constituents in Springfield are bringing concerns to him and that at least 10 were ‚Äúverifiable.‚Äù In a series of news show interviews, he said he was amplifying the claims as a way to draw attention to Democrat Kamala Harris' immigration policies, which he said are lax, while adding, "Everybody who has dealt with a large influx of migration knows that sometimes there are cultural practices that seem very far out there to a lot of Americans.‚Äù Local and state officials have said the claims are untrue, wrongly cast the city in a negative light and have brought unwanted and frightening negative attention since Trump mentioned it in the presidential debate last week, when he called out Springfield by name. For two days straight, bomb threats prompted the evacuation of schools and government buildings, with some emailed threats referencing an influx of migrants into the community. But it wasn‚Äôt just Springfield officials who were refuting the claims. Gov. Mike DeWine, R-Ohio, said Sunday that ‚Äúthere‚Äôs a lot of garbage on the internet and, you know, this is a piece of garbage that was simply not true. There‚Äôs no evidence of this at all.‚Äù He went...

content: Nach dem Chancenwucher beim 1:2 gegen den 1. FC Magdeburg koÃànnen sich die Gei√üboÃàcke vorerst keine weiteren RuÃàckschlaÃàge erlauben. FC KoÃàln Seltenheitswert. ‚ÄûWenn drei, vier Leute von Magdeburg nach dem Spiel auf einen zukommen und sich entschuldigen, dass sie das Spiel gewonnen haben, dann spricht das BaÃànde‚Äú, sagte Pacarada am Ende eines der eigenartigsten Fu√üballspiele der vergangenen Jahre in MuÃàngersdorf. Trotz erdruÃàckender Dominanz, die sich in 33:9 TorschuÃàssen, 17:6 Flanken und 10:2 Ecken widerspiegelte, waren die Hausherren als eigentlich nicht zu erklaÃàrender Verlierer aus dem Topspiel des fuÃànften Zweitliga-Spieltags herausgegangen. ‚ÄûEs war ein extrem dominantes Spiel. Wir kommen zu Riesenchancen. Wenn die Dinger reingehen, stehe ich hier und ihr gratuliert mir alle‚Äú, konnte es Pacarada auch in der Mixed Zone noch nicht so recht wahrhaben. title: Colts Star Defender Will Play vs Packers After Being Listed as Questionable
content: The Indianapolis Colts will have one of their biggest stars on the field when they take on the Green Bay Packers today. Defensive end DeForest Buckner will play today after being listed as questionable with a back injury. NFL insider Tom Pelissero reported the news on social media. title: Vance doesn't back away from false claims about migrants in Ohio even amid threats to the community
creator: The Canadian Press
content: WASHINGTON (AP) ‚Äî Republican vice presidential candidate did not back away on Sunday from the false claims he and have been making that Haitians in an are abducting and eating pets, even as the state's GOP governor and other officials insist there is no evidence of such behavior. Vance, an Ohio senator, said constituents in Springfield are bringing concerns to him and that at least 10 were ‚Äúverifiable.‚Äù In a series of news show interviews, he said he was amplifying the claims as a way to draw attention to Democrat Kamala Harris' immigration policies, which he said are lax, while adding, "Everybody who has dealt with a large influx of migration knows that sometimes there are cultural practices that seem very far out there to a lot of Americans.‚Äù Local and state officials have said the claims are untrue, wrongly cast the city in a negative light and have brought unwanted and frightening negative attention since Trump last week, when he called out Springfield by name. For two days straight, and government buildings, with some emailed threats referencing an influx of migrants into the community. But it wasn‚Äôt just Springfield officials who were refuting the claims. Gov. Mike DeWine, R-Ohio, said Sunday that ‚Äúthere‚Äôs a lot of garbage on the internet and, you know, this is a piece of garbage that was simply not true. There‚Äôs no evidence of this at all.‚Äù He went on to say: ‚ÄúLet me tell you what we do know, though. What we know is that the Haitians who are in Springfield are legal....

title: Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna celebrate son Aarav Bhatia‚Äôs 22nd birthday with heartfelt posts: 'Words can‚Äôt do justice...'
content: Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna ‚Äôs son Aarav Kumar is celebrating his 22nd birthday today. To mark the special occasion, The doting parents took to their Instagram in separate posts, and sent their best wishes to Aarav on his special day. Akshay shared a bright and joyful photo from a family vacation. The sunlit picture, taken during a safari trip, features Akshay, his wife Twinkle Khanna, and their son Aarav enjoying the outdoor setting. Along with the photo, Akshay wrote a heartfelt message for Aarav, expressing how proud he is of his son‚Äôs growth into a kind and loving person. In his Instagram post, Akshay wrote, ‚ÄúHappy Birthday Aarav! Watching you grow into the kind and loving person you are fills my heart with pride every single day. Words can‚Äôt do justice to how much joy you bring into my life. May this year bring you as much happiness as you give to everyone around you. Love you always ‚ù§Ô∏è.‚Äù Twinkle Khanna, being a writer, was more elaborate in her post as she shared how despite leaving home for studies, Aarav still lives in their hearts, diametrically opposite to what she thought would happen once he goes abroad. She wrote, ‚ÄúHappy birthday Aarav. When I used to listen to you repeatedly tell me how much you were looking forward to your independence, I would feel that when you finally leave my home and step into your own, my lights will go off automatically and my world will be filled with a bleak darkness. When you would return for a visit, I would light numerous diyas...

title: Paris Jackson is a glittering goddess in fitted dress for star-studded party in London
creator: Georgia Brown
content: Paris Jackson was amongst a glittering fleet of stars to grace the British Vogue and Rabanne party to celebrate London Fashion Week on Saturday night. The singer, who is the daughter of the late Michael Jackson , proved her fashion status by sporting a terracotta-hued tube dress adorned with all-over crystals. Paris, 26, paired her demure column dress with towering gold heels and a silver bag dripping in chainmail fringing. Her hair was worn loose and waved to suit her typical rocker aesthetic, whilst the star elevated her natural features with a golden bronzer, fluffy brow and romantic bronze-hued eye look. Over on Instagram, Paris delighted her 5.2 million followers with a behind-the-scenes look at her time in London over Fashion Week. In one playful photograph, the singer was seen hand feeding pigeons, while another snap showed Paris indulging in an afternoon tea. "Glad you're having such an awesome time there, Paris," gushed a fan in the comments, as another penned: "I knew it was London! Hyde Park, one of my favourite places!" The style maven is no stranger to a star-studded front row, having firmly cemented her sartorial status as worthy of a coveted 'FROW' seat at many worldwide fashion shows. The Swarm actress only recently flitted to London from New York, where she rocked a head-turning tartan ensemble at the Off-White runway. She was seated in good company for the occasion, spotted sitting next to her music maven bestie Camila Cabello who sported a sultry black...

title: Salvage efforts to rescue stricken Red Sea tanker Sounion makes 'slow' progress after oil ship was hit by Houthi missiles
content: Salvage efforts to rescue stricken Red Sea tanker Sounion makes 'slow' progress after oil ship was hit by Houthi missiles By Taryn Pedler Published: 16:43 BST, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 16:57 BST, 15 September 2024 e-mail View comments The rescue mission of stricken Red Sea tanker Sounion is reportedly making slow progress after the oil ship was targeted by Houthi missiles. The towing of the abandoned tanker which was struck by the Yemen rebels last month is proceeding slowly in its second day, according to a Greek military source. The operation which began Saturday 'is proceeding at a very slow pace', the source said, adding that it was 'initially headed north' without revealing a destination. The tanker was hit on August 21 by Iran-backed Houthis with small arms fire, missiles and a drone boat off the coast of Hodeida while carrying 136,000 tonnes of crude oil - setting off blasts that put the Red Sea at risk of a major oil spill four times the size of the 1989 Exxon Valdez disaster off Alaska . After the initial strike, the Houthis returned and detonated charges on the ship's deck, setting off new fires. Explosions took place on the deck of the Greek-flagged oil tanker Sounion on the Red Sea last month but the rescue mission is reportedly making slow progress The Iranian-backed Houthi militant group detonated explosives on the oil tanker MT SOUNION off the coast of Yemen on August 19 The operation is being overseen by the European Union 's Red Sea naval mission,...

title: ‚ÄòBeetlejuice Beetlejuice‚Äô is No. 1 again; conservative doc ‚ÄòAm I Racist‚Äô cracks box office top 5
creator: Associated Press
content: Moviegoers said yes to more ‚Äú ‚Äù this weekend. After its , the Tim Burton sequel easily topped the domestic box office charts again with $51.6 million in ticket sales, according to studio estimates Sunday. Down only 54% from a week earlier, the North American gross for the Warner Bros. release is already at $188 million. Internationally, it added $28.7 million, bringing its worldwide total to a staggering $264.3 million. While its hold was strong, ‚ÄúBeetlejuice Beetlejuice‚Äù didn‚Äôt have much in the way of major new competition. Fresh offerings included the James McAvoy horror ‚Äú ,‚Äù a satirical documentary following right wing podcaster Matt Walsh; and a new Dave Bautista action pic, ‚ÄúThe Killer's Game.‚Äù Second place in weekend ticket sales went to ‚Äú ,‚Äù a remake of a 2022 Danish horror film about an unsuspecting family who decides to spend a weekend with new friends in the country. McAvoy stars in it, along with Mackenzie Davis and Scoot McNairy. With positive reviews and a shrewd release date of Friday the 13th, the Blumhouse production released by Universal Pictures made an estimated $11.5 million from 3,375 locations. ‚Äú ‚Äù landed in third place in its eighth weekend with another $5.2 million. The Disney and Marvel blockbuster is now up to $621.5 million in North America and $1.3 billion globally. The Daily Wire movie ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù placed fourth at the box office, with an estimated $4.7 million from only 1,517 theaters. Described as a mockumentary in the style of ‚ÄúBorat,‚Äù the...

title: Death toll rises as rain and flooding force evacuations across central Europe
content: Another night of torrential rains pounding central Europe forced mass evacuations as the death toll rose on Sunday. Several central European nations have already been hit by severe flooding ‚Äì including Austria, the Czech Republic, Poland and Romania ‚Äì while Slovakia and Hungary might come next, as a result of a low pressure system from northern Italy dumping record rainfall in the region since Thursday. The floods have claimed five lives in Romania, one each in Austria and Poland. In the Czech Republic, four people who were swept away by waters were missing, police said. Most parts of the Czech Republic have been affected as authorities declared the highest flood warnings at around 100 places across the country. But the situation was worst in two north-eastern regions that recorded the biggest rainfall in recent days, including the Jeseniky mountains near the Polish border. In the city of Opava, up to 10,000 people out of a population of around 56,000 have been asked to leave their homes for higher ground. Rescuers used boats to transport people to safety in a neighbourhood flooded by the raging Opava River. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no reason to wait,‚Äù mayor Tomas Navratil told Czech public radio. He said that the situation was worse than during the last devastating floods in 1997, known as the ‚Äúflood of the century‚Äù. ‚ÄúWe have to focus on saving lives,‚Äù Prime Minister Petr Fiala told Czech public television on Sunday. His government was set to meet on Monday to assess the damages. The worst...

title: Trump says ‚ÄòI HATE TAYLOR SWIFT‚Äô in all-caps Truth Social post
creator: Andrea Cavallier
content: Former president Donald Trump went off on Taylor Swift online as he declared that he hates the singer, days after she endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris . He posted ‚ÄúI HATE TAYLOR SWIFT‚Äù in all caps on his Truth Social platform on Sunday morning. Last week, Swift endorsed Harris just after the presidential debate. ‚ÄúI will be casting my vote for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz in the 2024 Presidential Election,‚Äù Swift wrote in an Instagram post. Her call for voter registration drove more than 400,000 visitors to the vote.gov website in under 24 hours.

title: Transcript: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 15, 2024
content: The following is a transcript of an interview with Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, a Democrat, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 15, 2024. MARGARET BRENNAN: And we're joined now by Maryland Democratic Governor, Wes Moore. He's a member of the Harris campaign's National Advisory Board. Governor, I have a lot to get to with you, but I want to start on where we left the conversation with the senator from Ohio, JD Vance. He argues that talking about this strain on the local community from migrant populations should not be dismissed as racist by the Harris campaign, and should be discussed on its merits, merits. What do you make of the continued push to focus the conversation here? GOV. WES MOORE: Well, I mean, there's a remarkable amount of not just inaccuracies, but dog whistling that we heard from that. But you know, of all the many things that I think were really problematic with what Senator Vance said when at the end of the interview, when he started talking about the just some local elected official and what they have to say. These are people who are closest to the ground. These are the people who are closest to their constituents. These are public servants, and these are partners inside the work. And in the case of that Mayor, that's a Republican who's saying that that this isn't about politics, and it's not not about politicizing this issue. We know that to be able to address these issues, and particularly big, complex issues like the border crisis...

title: Over 50? Here's why your foundation is making you look older - and the seven products you need to take years off your face
content: Over 50? Here's why your foundation is making you look older - and the seven products you need to take years off your face By Hannah Betts For The Daily Mail Published: 16:52 BST, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 16:56 BST, 15 September 2024 e-mail View comments Fashion week, now in full swing, has turned my mind to what's in and what's out trend-wise. Obviously, a style needs to suit you to be worth pursuing. But, a tweak here, a refresh there, keeps midlifers looking current. Plus it's a lot of fun. First, what to ditch? Matte foundation is feeling old. I've called time on any bases that feel remotely flat or 'full-coverage'. Ditto non-luminous, or tinted powder. Radiant 'skin-minimalism' is what it's about: make-up/skincare hybrids that resemble a genuine, beautifully maintained complexion. Blush is so much the thing I'd pack in bronzer too, unless you think you need a light dusting to feel human. Bold brow pencils should go; ditto any eyeliner older than six months (three if your eyes feel sensitive). As for purchases, I can suggest: 1. Cleanser If you've been lax about make-up removal over summer, now is the time to boost your routine. I've fallen for Skin Rocks The Gel Cleanser (¬£39, skinrocks.com) from online beauty star Caroline Hirons. It's a gel-to-oil-to-milk, fortified by a barrier-boosting, six-oil fusion. Skin feels clean and cosseted in its wake. If funds won't run to this, try The Body Shop Camomile Jelly One-Step Cleanser (¬£12, thebodyshop.com). 2. Lipstick...

title: Sydney Sweeney Shares Rare Photos with FianceÃÅ Jonathan Davino During Trip to Universal Studios Hollywood
creator: People
content: The actress and Davino have been engaged since 2022 Sydney Sweeney/Instagram is giving a glimpse at life with ! On Saturday, Sept. 14, the actress, 27, shared rare photos with Davino, 41, on as the couple and their friends took a recent trip to the theme park in Universal City, Calif. "Came for @horrornights stayed for the minions," Sweeney captioned her post, in reference to the popular characters from the franchise. The first snap in the carousel, which also included fun videos from the outing, showed Sweeney posing in front of the Universal Studios arch with Davino and five of their friends. The group was dressed in merchandise in honor of the characters, with some wearing Minions t-shirts and others wearing themed hats. Though the actress typically keeps her relationship out of the public eye, she appeared to have her arm around her fianceÃÅ in the photo, with one leg raised in front of him. Next, the star posted a video with her arms wrapped around a friend as they rode down an escalator. In it, Sweeney wore an oversized white sweater with a black leather waist bag hanging from her shoulder. Another snap showed Sweeney covering her face as she sat at a table and looked at a large cake ‚Äì in what appeared to be part of a belated birthday celebration as the actress turned 27 on Thursday, Sept. 12. The carousel continued with more memories from her theme park trip, during which the actress, Davino and their friends visited and -themed attractions. In one photo, she posed...

title: Carbon pricing to cause economic ‚Äúnuclear winter,‚Äù Poilievre tells his MPs
creator: The Canadian Press
content: OTTAWA ‚Äî Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre signaled the Liberals' carbon price and the economy will remain his prime target when Parliament resumes this week. He painted a dystopian picture during a Sunday morning speech to his caucus, saying the Liberal government‚Äôs plans to increase the price would cause a ‚Äúnuclear winter‚Äù for the economy. He says further increases would cause widespread hunger and malnutrition and force seniors to turn down the heat in their homes just to stay afloat. He argues inflation would also run rampant and cause a collapse of the domestic economy. The Conservatives are the last of the major parties to have a fall strategy session after the Liberals, NDP and Bloc QueÃÅbeÃÅcois all met last week. Poilievre has maintained his party's commanding lead in the polls throughout the summer, and is preparing to make another push to topple the Liberal government as early as this week. All parties are adjusting their autumn plans after NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh ended the agreement that was ensuring the Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's Liberal government would stay in power. Poilievre has promised to bring in a non-confidence motion at his first opportunity, and that could happen as early as Monday. The Tories would likely need the support of both the NDP and the Bloc to pass the motion, which appears unlikely. This report by The Canadian Press was first published Sept. 15, 2024. Anja Karadeglija, The Canadian Press

title: Zelenskyy Urges West To Overcome Its 'Fear' And Let Ukraine Fire British Missiles Into Russia
creator: HuffPost UK
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy has called on the west to overcome its ‚Äúfear‚Äù and let Ukraine fire British long-range missiles into Russia. The Ukrainian president urged its allies to show ‚Äúdecisiveness‚Äù after Moscow launched fresh attacks on the city of Kharkiv. Posting on X, he said: ‚ÄúThe world must help us defend ourselves against Russian military aircraft and the dozens of guided aerial bombs that claim Ukrainian lives every day. ‚ÄúThis terror can be stopped. But to stop it, the fear of making strong, objectively necessary decisions must be overcome. Only decisiveness can bring a just end to this war. It is decisiveness that most effectively protects against terror.‚Äù A rescue operation is underway in Kharkiv following a Russian strike with aerial bombs. An ordinary residential high-rise building has been damaged. There is a fire and debris between the 9th and 12th floors. title: Le aritmie e il cardiopalmo: quando il cuore perde il ritmo
content: CREMONA - Protagonista della rubrica ‚ÄòIl medico risponde‚Äô eÃÄ direttore di ¬´Come dice il nome stesso, aritmia, eÃÄ l‚Äôassenza del ritmo del cuore. Possono essere benigne o maligne, della parte alta del cuore, quindi degli atri, o della parte bassa, ossia dei ventricoli. E hanno quindi possibilitaÃÄ diagnostica differente, cosiÃÄ come terapia e prognosi. In generale eÃÄ un disturbo del ritmo ed eÃÄ quanto ci riferiscono i nostri pazienti. Uno spettro dunque molto ampio con caratteristiche differenti¬ª. ¬´Le piuÃÄ pericolose sono quelle che insorgono nel cuore malato di pazienti che hanno avuto un‚Äôischemia cardiaca o problemi del muscolo cardiaco o ancora alle valvole cardiache. Nella persona con una cardiopatia strutturale le aritmie nascono nella parte bassa del cuore e sono piuÃÄ pericolose. Non tutte le aritmie ventricolari sono comunque pericolose. Poi ci sono le aritmie sopraventricolari che pur essendo benigne possono determinare perdita di coscienza, affanno, dolore toracico e dare origine a cadute a terra¬ª. ¬´I sintomi sono molto vaghi. La maggior parte dei pazienti con un cuore sostanzialmente sano o ammalato - giovani o anziani - viene in ambulatorio riferendo di avere le palpitazioni che possono avere una breve durata, essere ricorrenti o persistenti, in questo caso inducendo la persona a presentarsi al pronto soccorso per la diagnosi e l‚Äôindividuazione di una terapia. Il sintomo prevalente quindi resta il cardiopalmo¬ª. ¬´L‚Äôelettrocardiogramma quando il sintomo eÃÄ in corso....

content: Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna frequently share photos and videos of their happy family moments on social media. title: Disney+ adaptation of Jilly Cooper's bonkbuster Rivals will take 'equal opportunities' approach to nudity with a 'willy for every pair of t***', says producer
content: Disney+ adaptation of Jilly Cooper's bonkbuster Rivals will take 'equal opportunities' approach to nudity with a 'willy for every pair of t***', says producer Jilly Cooper's Rivals is set to air on Disney Plus from October 18 READ MORE: The very saucy remark about two young men Jilly Cooper whispered in my ear - and how the era of the bodice-ripping bonkbuster is back By Eleanor Dye Published: 16:52, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 16:55, 15 September 2024 e-mail View comments The Disney+ adaptation of Jilly Cooper's bonkbuster Rivals will take an 'equal opportunities' approach to nudity, according to the show's executive producer. The streaming channel has promised to bring a '2020s lens' to the 1980s classic - a notoriously politically incorrect tale of sex and scandal in the English social elite. The story focuses on the tense rivalry between Rupert Campbell-Black (Alex Hassell) and Lord Tony Baddingham (David Tennant). The racy eight-part series is set to air from October 18 - but many viewers have been left wondering how its themes would be translated for a modern audience. In an interview with The Times, writer and executive producer Dominic Treadwell-Collins, who has previously worked on EastEnders , has shed light on the much anticipated new TV seres. Jilly Cooper's Rivals has been adapted for the 21st century and is due to air on Disney+ next month (Jilly is pictured with Alex Hassell, Danny Dyer, David Tennant and Aidan Turner) He said: 'We‚Äôve been equal opportunities...

title: 2024 Solheim Cup Sunday singles scores: Charley Hull gives Europe big early win with rout of Nelly Korda
creator: USA TODAY Sports - Golfweek
content: It all comes down to this. The Sunday singles between the U.S. and the Europeans featured all 12 players on each side competing on the final day. The U.S. leads the all-time series 10-7-1 but hasn't won since 2017. The Americans lead this year's event 10-6 heading into the final day needing to need to earn 141‚ÅÑ2 points to win back the Cup. The first match out was Nelly Korda vs. Charley Hull and the world No. 1 Korda was chasing most of the day. Tied through five holes, Hull won three consecutive holes to take a big lead through eight. She took it to 4 up through 12 and then 5 up through 13. Korda was 3-0 prior to Sunday singles. Charley Hull (Europe) def. Nelly Korda (USA), 6 and 4 Megan Khang (USA) def. title: Oscar Piastri makes typical remark as McLaren driver admits he had "50-50" chance of crashing
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Tom Victor)
content: Oscar Piastri was brutally honest about the risk he was taking when passing Charles Leclerc en route to his Azerbaijan Grand Prix victory . Piastri made a bold move to overtake Leclerc on the inside, and was able to hold off the Monegasque to claim victory. Leclerc still made it onto the podium in second, with George Russell climbing into third after a late crash between Sergio Perez and Carlos Sainz . It brought a second win of the season for Australian driver Piastri , who also won in Hungary . Leclerc was chasing back-to-back wins after victory in Monza , but couldn't fully capitalise after qualifying on pole. The three podium finishers were seen exchanging words in the cooldown room after the race as they reflected on the action. And there was only one place to begin. "To be honest, when I hit the brakes I was like 'There's a 50-50 chance whether I make this corner or not'," Piastri said . Leclerc put on a brave face as he attempted to explain why the recovery never came. "Yeah I just broke the way I was breaking normally," the Ferrari driver admitted. "I saw you go in so I was like 'He's not going to release the brakes... okay, I'll just let him go and take the DRS and try to overtake you', and that never happened." "To be honest there were about 10 laps where I thought it was going to happen," Piastri replied. "But once I got clean air I thought 'Okay, maybe my life will be a bit easier now'." title: Plan von RW Walldorf geht gegen die U21 des SV 98 auf
content: WALLDORF. ‚ÄûUns sind heute die Grenzen aufgezeigt worden‚Äú, sagte Trainer Daniel Petrowsky: ‚ÄûWir haben viel, viel Lernstoff mit nach Hause zu nehmen.‚Äú Gerade hatte seine U21 des SV Darmstadt 98 beim SV Rot-Wei√ü Walldorf mit 0:3 (0:2) in der Fu√üball-Hessenliga verloren. Walldorf bleibt mit ihrem siebten Sieg im achten Saisonspiel erster Verfolger von Spitzenreiter FC Bayern Alzenau, den sie am kommenden Samstag (15 Uhr) in Unterfranken herausfordert. Das Walldorfer FuÃàhrungstor gelang Imad Jaadar mit einem herrlichen Flugkopfball nach Flanke von Kento Takenaka (26.). Jener wieselflinke Mittelfeldspieler, der erst kurzfristig in die Startelf gekommen war, weil sich Aid Sulejmani bei der letzten Aktion seines AufwaÃàrmprogramms verletzt hatte: Bei einem Schuss verspuÃàrte er ein Ziehen im Adduktorenbereich. Den kleinsten gemeinsamen Nenner von Sieger und Verlierer nannte Marcus Spahn, Sportlicher Leiter der Rot-Wei√üen: ‚ÄûWir haben ein gutes Spiel gesehen. Da war viel Tempo drin.‚Äú Petrowsky befand, seine Mannschaft habe keine Mittel gegen das Offensivpressing des Tabellenzweiten gefunden: ‚ÄûWir waren bei den zweiten BaÃàllen gefuÃàhlt immer ein, zwei Schritte langsamer. Da haben wir uns ein bisschen den Schneid abkaufen lassen.‚Äú Genau das war der Plan des SV Rot-Wei√ü, machte RWW-Trainer Artur Lemm deutlich. Allerdings hatten die Lilien den besseren Start in die Begegnung der beiden juÃàngsten Mannschaften dieser Liga. Mateo Zelic tauchte frei vor RWW-TorhuÃàter Denis Wieszolek auf und...

title: Ciao bella! Sofia Vergara, Heather Graham and Teresa Giudice as well as JLo, Kylie Jenner and Angelina Jolie lit up Italy this summer
content: Ciao bella! Sofia Vergara, Heather Graham and Teresa Giudice as well as JLo, Kylie Jenner and Angelina Jolie lit up Italy this summer By Heidi Parker For Dailymail.com Published: 11:31 EDT, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 11:55 EDT, 15 September 2024 e-mail 3 View comments Advertisement The coast of Italy was the place to be this summer for Hollywood celebrities. Several luminaries jetted to the boot to drink Prosecco, eat gelato, swim in the Mediterranean and work on their tans as they stayed in top luxury resorts. Some even took a yacht out to pretend they're like Jenny From The Block. Others did some work while they were in the Country Of Pasta. Among the VIPs to hit the country were Kylie Jenner, Sofia Vergara , Angelina Jolie, Heather Graham , Devon Windsor and Melissa Gorga . Italy, a European country with a long Mediterranean coastline, has left a powerful mark on Hollywood. Its capital, Rome, is home to the Vatican as well as landmark art and ancient ruins. Other major cities include Florence, Venice, and Milan. But stars hugged the coast as they hit cities like Sorrento, Rome, Positano and islands like Capri. Here is a look at how the beauties traveled with seemingly unlimited funds. KYLIE JENNER Kylie Jenner was seen in Italy with her kids Stormi, six, and Aire, two, in July. The reality TV dynamo wore pretty dresses as she added glam with red lipstick and gold jewelry. The makeup mogul - who has been working on Khy - was also with her longtime friend from Calabasas,...

title: Tim Sulteng Dicurangi, Erick Thohir Kirim Wasit Liga 1 Pimpin Semifinal PON Aceh-Sumut
content: Ketua Umum PSSI, , mengeluarkan instruksi agar pertandingan semifinal dan final cabor sepak bola PON Aceh-Sumut 2024 dipimpin wasit Liga 1. Pada PON 2024 ini, cabor sepak bola menggunakan wasit Liga 3. Perintah mengganti wasit dikeluarkan Erick setelah insiden pertandingan perempat final antara Aceh vs Sulteng, Sabtu (14/9/2024) kemarin Di mana, wasit Eko Agus Sugiharto yang memimpin pertandingan berpihak kepada tuan rumah Aceh. Karena ulahnya itu, Eko kena bogem mentah dari pemain Sulteng, Rizki Saputra karena memberi hadiah penalti tim tuan rumah di menit ke-90+7. Hasilnya, Rizki Saputra pun dikenai kartu merah sementara Eko Agus tidak bisa melanjutkan pertandingan karena dilarikan ke luar lapangan menggunakan ambulan. Laga yang sempat terhenti selama 20 menit pun akhirnya dilanjutkan dengan wasit pengganti. Adapun saat kembali dimulai, tim tuan rumah yang mendapatkan penalti gagal mengeksekusinya. Hingga di menit selanjutnya, Aceh kembali mendapatkan hadiah penalti setelah pemain Sulteng melakukan handsball hingga mampu menetralkan keadaan melalui skor 1-1. Namun, Sulteng yang merasa banyak dirugikan wasit menolak untuk melanjutkan pertandingan. Laga pun dimenangkan oleh Aceh skor 1-1 setelah tim lawan walkout. Kini, insiden pertandingan yang telah menjadi sorotan publik memaksa pihak PSSI turun tangan untuk memperbaiki. Arya Sinulingga, selaku Exco PSSI menerangkan, langkah-langkah yang diambil Ketum PSSI untuk pertandingan sepak bola PON 2024 yang tersisa. Pertama, PSSI...

title: NFL Rumors: Jordan Love Targets Week 5 Return for Packers vs. Rams After Knee Injury
creator: Julia Stumbaugh
content: Green Bay Packers quarterback Jordan Love is targeting a Week 5 return against the Los Angeles Rams from his knee injury, NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reported Sunday. ESPN's Adam Schefter initially reported that Love would miss three to four weeks after suffering a sprained MCL on Sept. 6. Schefter noted that MCL injuries "typically" do not necessitate surgery. The injury occurred in the final seconds of the Packers' season-opening loss to the Philadelphia Eagles in SaÃÉo Paulo, Brazil. Love had gone 17-of-34 for 260 yards, two touchdowns and an interception before he was helped off the field. NFL Network's Tom Pelissero reported on Sept. 8 that the Packers were "focused on preparing Malik Willis and Sean Clifford" ahead of the team's home opener against the Indianapolis Colts on Sunday. The Packers acquired Willis from the Tennessee Titans in late August after Clifford struggled in the preseason. The two quarterbacks had made a combined total of 13 NFL appearances and three starts heading into the 2024 season. Willis made his Packers debut when he stepped in as relief for Love in the final moments of the 2024 season opener in Brazil. The 2022 third-rounder threw an incompletion before taking a sack on the final play of the game. Love started 17 games in his first campaign as the Packers' starter, marking a 9-8 record while recording 4,159 yards, 32 touchdowns and 11 interceptions to lead the Packers into the divisional round. His injury occurred just over one month after the...

title: Tottenham 0-1 Arsenal: Which Spurs star 'didn't deserve to lose'? An Arsenal star oozes quality... but which defender struggled and scored 5.5?
content: Tottenham 0-1 Arsenal: Which Spurs star 'didn't deserve to lose'? An Arsenal star oozes quality... but which defender struggled and scored 5.5? Gabriel headed in a corner from Bukayo Saka to help Arsenal seal a 1-0 victory By Sami Mokbel and Isaan Khan Published: 16:24, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 16:54, 15 September 2024 e-mail 1 View comments Arsenal edged a heated north London derby on Sunday afternoon thanks to a second half header from Gabriel. In what was a heated first half that saw the most yellow cards shown in the opening 45 minutes of any Premier League game ever, the players clashed after Jurrien Timber narrowly avoided a red card. It was tight in the second half too, with Gabriel heading in Bukayo Saka 's corner for the only goal of the game. Arsenal went second with the win, while Tottenham remain in the bottom half after a difficult start to the campaign. Mail Sport's SAMI MOKBEL and ISAAN KHAN give their ratings from north London. Gabriel (left) scored the only goal of the game as Arsenal beat Tottenham in the north London derby on Sunday The defender, alongside William Saliba (right) helped his side to yet another clean sheet too Mikel Arteta (pictured) has now won three north London derbies away from home in a row - a feat Arsene Wenger failed to achieve Podcast All episodes PODCAST: Have England been playing with fear as Southgate suggests? title: Trump tears into Taylor Swift in blazing Truth Social rage after pop megastar endorsed Kamala Harris
content: BREAKING NEWS Trump tears into Taylor Swift in blazing Truth Social rage after pop megastar endorsed Kamala Harris Swift revealed after Tuesday's debate she is voting for VP Kamala Harris By Katelyn Caralle, Senior U.S. Political Reporter In Washington, D.C. Published: 11:53 EDT, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 11:57 EDT, 15 September 2024 e-mail 4 View comments Donald Trump says he hates Taylor Swift after the pop star endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris . 'I HATE TAYLOR SWIFT!' the former president lamented on his social media website Truth Social on Sunday. It comes just five days after Swift said in a lengthy Instagram post that she would be voting for Harris in November. She also encouraged her millions of followers to do their research on the election and register to vote with a link she shared of vote.gov on her Instagram story sharing her grid post. Donald Trump responded to Taylor Swift's endorsement of Kamala Harris by saying he 'hates' the pop star Trump posted 'I HATE TAYLOR SWIFT!' on his Truth Social just five days after she revealed she was voting for Kamala Harris in November Trump's post on Sunday is his most poignant response to Swift so far. Right after the debate on Tuesday, Trump was asked about his reaction to Swift's endorsement and he replied simply with: 'I have no idea.' title: Leider ist das 5. Mittelalterfest in Zug schon wieder Geschichte
content: Max Landtwing Mehrere 10'000 Besucher erlebten rund um die Burg, dem Pulverturm und dem Daheimpark einen Einblick in die Zeit des Mittelalters. Viele Handwerker zeigten Vergessenes Brauchtum und man konnte sich ein Bild machen wie man im Mittelalter lebte. Vor allem im Daheimpark wo ein Heerlager aufgestellt war, konnten Gross und Klein sich daruÃàber orientieren. Auch wurde ZeitgemaÃàsse Unterhaltung geboten mit Gaukler und Musikanten, die mit ihrer mittelalterlichen Musik und Gauklereien die Besucher unterhielten. Es wurde auch fuÃàr das leibliche Wohl gesorgt wie es im Mittelalter zubereitet wurde, was viele Besucher sehr schaÃàtzten. Es ist auch positiv zu erwaÃàhnen, dass der ganze Anlass ohne Wegzoll zu erleben war und daraus auch das Interesse von nah und fern nach Zug um ins Mittelalter zu kommen und einzutauchen von vielen sehr geschaÃàtzt wurde. Das Organisationskomitee des VMFZ moÃàchte sich bei allen Sponsoren, Helfern und Besuchern recht herzlich bedanken, denn ohne Sie waÃàre es nicht moÃàglich gewesen, so ein Fest auf die Beine zu stellen. title: Grim warming to Aussie mortgage holders clinging to hope of an interest rate cut
content: Grim warning to Aussie mortgage holders clinging to hope of an interest rate cut RTA tipped to 'ignore' headline data READ MORE: Inside the RBA's $80,000 Christmas party By Duncan Evans For Nca Newswire Published: 16:54, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 17:03, 15 September 2024 e-mail View comments There's likely to be more suffering ahead for Aussie homeowners buckling under years of tightening mortgage stress, with a leading industry forecaster warning interest rate relief could still be many months away. Oxford Economics Australia expects the Reserve Bank of Australia to begin cutting rates in the second quarter of 2025, far beyond a late 2024 cut expected by other forecasters including banking giant Commonwealth Bank . 'Given the RBA's hawkish rhetoric, we don't see rate cuts coming until the second quarter of 2025,' Oxford Economics Australia head of macroeconomic forecasting Sean Langcake said ahead of the research firm's biannual economic outlook . Mr Langcake credits 'strong cross currents' in the Australian economy for the delayed cut, with policymakers navigating a 'challenging' outlook and environment. 'The labour market has defied a marked slowdown in activity, which is testing the RBA's very patient approach to bringing inflation back to its target,' he said. 'Concurrently, a significant easing in fiscal policy will give the economy a boost, which is welcome for households, but less so for inflation hawks.' The forecaster expects headline inflation to be very close...

title: For this AP photographer, joy was all in the hands for a group of released political prisoners
creator: Moises Castillo
content: MoiseÃÅs Castillo joined the AP in 1994 at the age of 19, covering Central America and Mexico while based in Guatemala City . He has reported on the end of the civil war in Guatemala, coups and other breaking news in Latin America, numerous natural disasters including earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, and the migration crisis. He has also covered major sporting events such as Copa America, Pan American Games, the World Cup and the recent Olympics in Paris. Why this photo? On the morning of Sept. 5, the U.S. government announced the release of 135 Nicaraguan political prisoners, who were to be received in Guatemala City. The announcement came as a complete surprise. We found the freed prisoners at one of the exits of the airbase they were flown to as they were being set up for transportation to different hotels. The newly released prisoners, who had to leave their home country, reacted with joy and gratitude. From the bus, several of them shouted, ‚ÄúLong live free Nicaragua!‚Äù while waving their hands out the windows or showing their passports. How I made this photo I had packed long lenses, expecting to photograph the plane that transported the freed prisoners on the airbase runway from far away but, in the end, that was no longer possible. Instead, they were already on a bus, and the driver was maneuvering to leave. They were right in front of me. With my Sony A1 camera and a wide-angle 35mm 1.4 lens, I began taking photos of their hands as they tried to get the attention of...

title: Polisi Tetapkan IS Warga Padang Pariaman Jadi Tersangka Pembunuhan Gadis Penjual Gorengan
content: Setelah melakukan pemeriksaan terhadap sejumlah saksi termasuk mengumpulkan alat bukti di lokasi kejadian. Polisi akhirnya menetapkan seorang berinisial IS sebagai tersangka pembunuhan (18), gadis . Hal tersebut dikatakan Kasat Reskrim Polres , Iptu AA Reggy. Ia mengatakan, penetapan tersangka terhadap IS dilakukan setelah polisi melakukan pemeriksaan terhadap sejumlah saksi termasuk mengumpulkan alat bukti di lokasi kejadian. "Berdasarkan fakta, barang bukti, dan keterangan saksi, kami telah menetapkan tersangka dalam kasus ini dengan inisial IS," katanya yang dilansir dari TribunPadang.com, Minggu (15/9/2024). IS diketahui merupakan warga . Saat ini, tersangka masih dalam diburu kepolisian. Pelaku diduga bersembunyi di hutan yang berada di sekitar lokasi kejadian. Warga sempat melihat pelaku bersembunyi di di sebuah gubuk yang berada di hutan. Polisi pun mendatangi gubuk tersebut. Ternyata, pelaku sudah melarikan diri dan hanya menemukan tas milik pelaku. "Hari ini, kami menemukan satu tas milik pelaku," kata AKBP Ahmad Faisol Amir dilansir dari Tribunpadang.com. Namun, Faisol tidak merinci isi yang ada di dalam tas milik terduga pelaku.

Real Madrid cancels concerts at its stadium after loud late gigs turned the Bernabeu in a 'torture-drome'
content: Real Madrid cancels concerts at its stadium after loud late gigs turned the Bernabeu in a 'torture-drome' The BernabeÃÅu stadium recently underwent a five-year, ¬£760m refurbishment By Katherine Lawton Published: 11:50 EDT, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 11:54 EDT, 15 September 2024 e-mail View comments Real Madrid has cancelled or rescheduled concerts at its BernabeÃÅu stadium in Spain after loud gigs late at night turned the arena into a 'torture-drome'. The BernabeÃÅu recently underwent a five-year, ¬£760million refurbishment and held a number of high-profile concerts earlier this year. Major headliners have included Taylor Swift , Colombian star Karol G and Luis Miguel. But the noisy concerts have driven some locals to despair, with a group representing those living around the stadium beginning legal action. The locals complained about late finish times, fans camping in local parks, the blocking of roads and drunk people urinating in doorways. Taylor Swift fans queue to enter the concert outside Santiago Bernabeu stadium in Madrid, Spain, on May 29 The BernabeÃÅu stadium (pictured) recently underwent a five-year, ¬£760million refurbishment Taylor Swift performs on strage during The Eras Tour at the BernabeÃÅu stadium in Madrid In a statement, the club said: 'Real Madrid FC is announcing that it has decided to provisionally reschedule its event and concert programme at the Santiago BernabeÃÅu stadium. 'This decision is part of a raft of measures that the club is taking to ensure...

title: Trattenuto ¬´senza motivo¬ª nel Cpr di Brindisi: ecuadoriano fa causa al ministero dell'Interno
creator: redazione.internet@gazzettamezzogiorno.it
content: BRESCIA - E‚Äô stato trattenuto ¬´senza motivo" nel Centro di permanenza per i rimpatri (Cpr) di Brindisi e ora attraverso il suo legale ha citato il ministero dell‚ÄôInterno davanti al Tribunale di Roma chiedendo un risarcimento di 50mila euro. E‚Äô la storia di un 25enne dell‚ÄôEcuador, domiciliato a Milano, difeso dall‚Äôavvocato bresciano Stefano Afrune. Richiedente asilo politico, in Italia ¬´fin dalla prima adolescenza dove ha studiato e poi lavorato¬ª, era stato portato una prima volta nel Cpr di Roma, ma il Tribunale non aveva convalidato il provvedimento. Tornato libero si era presentato negli uffici della Questura di Milano per presentare domanda di protezione internazionale. Qui eÃÄ stata peroÃÄ nuovamente azionata nei suoi confronti la procedura di trattenimento in un Cpr e quindi trasferito a Brindisi dal primo al 5 agosto scorso, quando il Tribunale di Lecce lo ha rimesso in libertaÃÄ sostenendo che - cosiÃÄ come indicato dal Tribunale di Roma - non c'erano ragioni per il trattenimento ritenuto ¬´privo dei presupposti che lo giustificano¬ª. ¬´E' evidente che il ragazzo eÃÄ stato privato della libertaÃÄ personale in maniera arbitraria ed illegittima¬ª, scrive l'avvocato Stefano Afrune nella richiesta danni contro il ministero dell‚ÄôInterno.

title: 'Third party influence' to have major impact on outcome of election
creator: Falyn Stempler
content: A third-party ballot has the potential to spoil the outcome of the November election, political experts have warned. Despite dropping out of the race and endorsing Donald Trump , Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will still remain on several ballots including in at least two key swing states , Michigan and Wisconsin, after his eleventh-hour drop out in late August proved difficult at best and unlawful at worst to accommodate. This proves particularly worrisome because the election is projected to be a close race as Trump and Kamala Harris are polling neck-in-neck in battleground states, which means RFK Jr. will be taking away critical votes from a primary party candidate. Razor-thin margins in polls before ABC TV debate as RFK Jr adds major twist Disaster for Trump as less than half of RFK Jr voters switch to former president Already, RFK Jr.'s ballot is causing problems in a key swing state, North Carolina, after its Supreme Court ruled it has to destroy and reprint millions ballots to accommodate his last-minute withdrawal, which he didn't officially file for in the state until five days after deadline and four days after suspending his campaign. This may particularly affect mail-in voters living out of state, including service members overseas, which goes against federal statutes. The likelihood of a third-party ballot altering the election is not implausible as it affected the outcome of a US election not so long ago, said Jo Freeman, a prolific feminist author with a PhD in...

En face, Stockay est inexistant et peine aÃÄ sortir proprement le cuir. Dans les cordes, les visiteurs doivent donc logiquement courber l'eÃÅchine quand Toutou Martins se racheÃÄte de son incroyable rateÃÅ initial pour ouvrir le score aÃÄ quelques minutes de la pause sur une offrande de Hendrickx. title: Top legal adviser to New York City mayor quits as investigations swell
creator: The Canadian Press
content: NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî The top legal adviser to New York City Mayor Eric Adams resigned abruptly over the weekend, the latest sign of instability in the Democrat's administration as it deals with multiple federal investigations. City Hall announced Lisa Zornberg's departure late Saturday night. She had advised Adams and other city officials on legal strategy for over a year and often parried legal questions from the press on his behalf. She was not his personal lawyer. ‚ÄúIt has been a great honor to serve the City. I am tendering my resignation, effective today, as I have concluded that I can no longer effectively serve in my position. I wish you nothing but the best,‚Äù Zornberg wrote in a three-sentence resignation letter to Adams. The resignation comes after the phones of multiple members of Mayor Eric Adams' inner circle were , including the head of New York City's police department, Zornberg, a former federal prosecutor in the U.S. attorney's office now leading some of the investigations into the Adams administration, wasn't one of the officials who had their phones seized. The police commissioner, Edward Caban resigned citing the ‚Äúdistraction‚Äù created by news of the the investigations. Federal authorities haven't disclosed the subjects of the investigations. Besides the police commissioner, phones were taken from the head of the public schools system, a top deputy mayor, and two top advisers to Adams on public safety issues. Investigators seized devices from Caban‚Äôs twin...

title: Alert youth foils Ganja smuggling attempt in Kothagudem
content: An alleged attempt to smuggle ganja in an ambulance was foiled by alert local youth in Ramavaram area in Kothagudem town in the early hours of Sunday after the vehicle got stranded on the roadside following a tyre burst. Sources said that the ambulance bearing Tamil Nadu registration number was heading towards Kothagudem from Odisha when one of its tyres burst early on Sunday morning. The driver of the empty ambulance sought the help of some locals to get the tyre repaired. The local youth grew suspicious of the attitude of the driver and opened the stationary ambulance door. They reportedly found several packets of ganja in the vehicle and immediately alerted the local police. The police reportedly detained the crew of the empty ambulance for questioning. However, the police were yet to confirm the exact quantity of the ganja reportedly found concealed in the vehicle. title: Rennes routs Montpellier 3-0 in French league
creator: The Canadian Press
content: PARIS (AP) ‚Äî The French league season marking 's 50th anniversary is just four matches old, but there are alarming signs it could be a nightmare for the southern city's team. Montpellier's ambitions have been hampered by the , preventing the club from securing the reinforcements it planned. The result? Montpellier sits in last place and is still winless after Sunday's 3-0 loss at that marked its third defeat in four matches so far. In addition to its financial issues, Montpellier traveled to Rennes with several injured players ‚Äî its three left-backs are currently sidelined ‚Äî and was second best throughout the afternoon. put the hosts in front in the 24th minute and goals from and Albert Gronbaek completed the win. It was Rennes' second victory this season. Montpellier won the French league title once, in 2012, when it upset Paris Saint-Germain. Montpellier‚Äôs title-winning squad featured nine homegrown players, in contrast to PSG‚Äôs relentless pursuit of stars at the expense of its own youth academy. The club also won the second division title in 1987 and the French Cup in 1990 with a team featuring the likes of Eric Cantona, Laurent Blanc and Julio Cesar. at the top of the standings with a fourth win in as many games on Saturday. scored twice in the 3-1 win against Brest. PSG has a two-point lead at the top. ___ AP soccer: The Associated Press

title: While ex-coach Fabian HuÃàrzeler dazzles the Premier League St. Pauli is struggling in Germany
creator: The Canadian Press
content: AUGSBURG, Germany (AP) ‚Äî Fabian HuÃàrzeler is the English Premier League's after going unbeaten in his first four league games at . His old club is in trouble already. The 31-year-old Texas-born coach got Hamburg-based St. Pauli back to the last season for the first time since 2011, but left a month later to join Brighton. Three games into the Bundesliga season and St. Pauli has yet to earn a point. Now coached by Alexander Blessin, Sunday's 3-1 loss at Augsburg left St. Pauli in the relegation zone. At least it shed the unwanted record of being the league's only team yet to score a goal. New signing gave Augsburg the lead shortly after halftime with his first Bundesliga goal since August 2022, before headed in a second. 's header got St. Pauli back into the game but 's added-time goal secured the win for Augsburg. The only team below St. Pauli in the table is the other promoted club, , which has three losses and a goal difference of minus 8 after being on Saturday. Augsburg's win was its first of the season in the Bundesliga and came three days after coach Jess Thorup was given a contract extension through 2026. Mainz hosted in the Bundesliga later Sunday. ___ AP soccer: The Associated Press

title: Rain washes out England-Australia T20I series finale
content: NEW DELHI: Persistent rain on Sunday forced the abandonment of the third Twenty20 match between England and Australia at Old Trafford. The match, scheduled to start at 2:30 pm local time, was called off without even toss happening in Manchester. Both the toss and the match were delayed as rain fell throughout the morning, creating deep puddles on the covers that protected the pitch. The official cut-off time for a minimum five-overs-per-side match was set at 5:46 pm. However, a fresh downpour just before a planned pitch inspection led the umpires to call off the match at 4:18 pm. The series ended in a 1-1 draw. England's win in the second T20 match in Cardiff, led by Liam Livingstone's score of 87, followed Australia's victory in the opening match in Southampton. England will next play a five-match one-day international series against Australia, starting at Trent Bridge in Nottingham on Thursday.

title: Top legal adviser to New York City mayor quits as investigations swell
creator: Cedar Attanasio
content: The top legal adviser to New York City Mayor Eric Adams resigned abruptly over the weekend, the latest sign of instability in the Democrat's administration as it deals with multiple federal investigations. City Hall announced Lisa Zornberg's departure late Saturday night. She had advised Adams and other city officials on legal strategy for over a year and often parried legal questions from the press on his behalf. She was not his personal lawyer. ‚ÄúIt has been a great honor to serve the City. I am tendering my resignation, effective today, as I have concluded that I can no longer effectively serve in my position. I wish you nothing but the best,‚Äù Zornberg wrote in a three-sentence resignation letter to Adams. The resignation comes after the phones of multiple members of Mayor Eric Adams' inner circle were seized by federal investigators, including the head of New York City's police department, who resigned Thursday. Zornberg, a former federal prosecutor in the U.S. attorney's office now leading some of the investigations into the Adams administration, wasn't one of the officials who had their phones seized. The police commissioner, Edward Caban resigned citing the ‚Äúdistraction‚Äù created by news of the the investigations. Federal authorities haven't disclosed the subjects of the investigations. Besides the police commissioner, phones were taken from the head of the public schools system, a top deputy mayor, and two top advisers to Adams on public safety issues. Investigators...

title: Annual Battle of Britain service at Westminster Abbey sees flypast watched by Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer
content: Annual Battle of Britain service at Westminster Abbey sees flypast watched by Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer By Matt Strudwick Published: 11:49 EDT, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 11:52 EDT, 15 September 2024 e-mail View comments Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer and former premier Rishi Sunak attended Westminster Abbey today to mark the 84th Battle of Britain Anniversary Service. Sir Keir and Mr Sunak both met Venerable Dr Giles Legood, Chaplain-in-Chief of the Royal Air Force , and watched the carrying of the Battle of Britain Roll of Honour. The pair also stood together on a balcony to watch a Second World War-era flypast over Westminster Abbey featuring a Lancaster Bomber. The service included readings from Chief of the Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal Sir Richard Knighton, Dr Legood and Sergeant Angela Luddington. Members of the Royal Air Force also sang hymns throughout the ceremony. Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer attended Westminster Abbey today to mark the 84th Battle of Britain Anniversary Service Former premier Rishi Sunak also attended the service today A Lancaster Bomber flies during a flypast over Westminster Abbey Mr Sunak Sir Keir stand on a balcony together as they watch a flypast over Westminster Abbey The service marks the victory, and loss of life, by the Royal Air Force during the Battle of Britain in 1940. Westminster Abbey has held a service of thanksgiving and rededication on Battle of Britain Sunday every year since 1944. The event, which was held between 11am...

Weniger als 0,1 Prozent der Ausreisepflichtigen aus Usbekistan Bei letzterem Punkt geht es allerdings nur um rund 200 Personen. Das sind weniger als 0,1 Prozent aller 225.000 ausreisepflichtigen Migranten in Deutschland. Insgesamt leben 13.700 Usbeken in Deutschland. Abkommen mit einzelnen HerkunftslaÃàndern sind ein zentraler Bestandteil der Migrationspolitik der Ampel-Regierung. Um sie auszuhandeln, hat sie mit Joachim Stamp eigens einen Beauftragten eingesetzt. Sechstes Migrationsabkommen Erst am vergangenen Freitag wurde in Berlin ein Migrationsabkommen mit Kenia unterzeichnet, mit Indien, Georgien, Marokko und Kolumbien gibt es solche Vereinbarungen schon laÃànger. Mit Moldau und Kirgistan sind die Verhandlungen bereits weit fortgeschritten, und auch mit den Philippinen und Ghana laufen GespraÃàche. Die Abkommen basieren immer auf zwei SaÃàulen: Abschiebung von Personen ohne Bleiberecht und Anwerbung von FachkraÃàften fuÃàr den deutschen Arbeitsmarkt. L‚ÄôeÃÅquipe a pu constater que d‚Äôautres voitures parvenaient aÃÄ se deÃÅbarrasser du graining, mais cela nous a pris beaucoup plus de temps." "Lorsque nous y sommes parvenus, nous avons pu revenir et retrouver un peu de rythme, mais nous avions perdu beaucoup de terrain. Je n‚Äôai jamais connu un tel graining, la variation du temps au tour a eÃÅteÃÅ de quatre secondes." "Nous devons comprendre pourquoi nous avons eu plus de graining pendant plus longtemps. Pour ce qui est de la suite, j‚Äôadore le circuit urbain de Marina Bay, alors j‚ÄôespeÃÄre que nous pourrons y faire un meilleur week-end." Yuki Tsunoda a eÃÅteÃÅ accrocheÃÅ au premier tour par Lance Stroll. title: Menparekraf Sandiaga Uno Dorong UMKM di Palembang Mendunia
content: jpnn.com , PALEMBANG - Kehadiran Menteri Pariwisata dan Ekonomi Kreatif (Menparekraf) Sandiaga Uno di Kota Palembang memberikan angin segar bagi para pelaku UMKM. Pasalnya, agenda Kelana Nusantara dalam rangka Pengembangan Kabupaten/Kota Kreatif Indonesia, Minggu (15/9), melibatkan para pelaku UMKM di Kota Palembang. Pada kesempatan itu, UMKM di Kota Palembang berkesempatan berdiskusi dan mendapatkan ilmu baru langsung dengan para narasumber. Mereka juga berkesempatan menampilkan dan melakukan promosi masing-masing produk, mulai dari kuliner hingga kain khas daerah, di hadapan Menparekraf. Sandiaga Uno menyampaikan bahwa inovasi-inovasi seperti itu harus lebih banyak dikembangkan, begitu juga dengan berbagai event. Mantan wakil gubernur DKI Jakarta itu juga mengingatkan pentingnya berkolaborasi dalam pengembangan usaha. "Bermitra lebih baik, kolaborasi, tetapi harus teliti dalam memilih yang satu visi dan pemerintah harus menghadirkan pelatihan dan pendampingan," kata Sandi, Minggu. Dia menambahkan ada beberapa terobosan yang akan dikembangkan dan didiskukan bersama Penjabat (Pj) Wali Kota Palembang.

title: Abbie Chatfield shares her shame over breaking cardinal skincare rule that left her complexion 'crook'
content: Abbie Chatfield shares her shame over breaking cardinal skincare rule that left her complexion 'crook' READ MORE: Abbie Chatfield blasts fan who slammed her for going braless in crude tirade By Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia Published: 16:49 BST, 15 September 2024 | Updated: 16:51 BST, 15 September 2024 e-mail View comments Abbie Chatfield has confessed that she didn't always have the best skincare habits. The podcaster shared her shame in a TikTok post this week, revealing that she often wore a full face of glamorous makeup - and slept in it. In a further post to Instagram, Abbie begged her fans to comment their own 'crook' skincare habits to make her feel better. She also posted a throwback image in which she wore a heavy makeup look including glitter shadow and thick foundation. 'The full glitter cut crease for a hospitality job? I had much more energy then' she joked in her caption. It comes after Abbie slammed ticket sellers for allegedly informing fans about show cancellations via 'cold and random' texts . The FBoy Island host's upcoming national Trauma Dump tour has been hit with difficulties over low ticket sales, forcing her to cancel a string of shows. Abbie, 29, has so far confirmed that she has axed four of the scheduled 13 shows - Ballarat, Port Macquarie, Caloundra, and Cairns, cancelled due to low demand . Abbie Chatfield (pictured) has confessed that she didn't always have the best skincare habits Now, Abbie has taken to Instagram to fume over the way...

title: Rennes routs Montpellier 3-0 in French league
creator: AP
content: PARIS (AP) ‚Äî The French league season marking Montpellier's 50th anniversary is just four matches old, but there are alarming signs it could be a nightmare for the southern city's team. Montpellier's ambitions have been hampered by the significant drop in television rights revenues , preventing the club from securing the reinforcements it planned. The result? Montpellier sits in last place and is still winless after Sunday's 3-0 loss at Rennes that marked its third defeat in four matches so far. In addition to its financial issues, Montpellier traveled to Rennes with several injured players ‚Äî its three left-backs are currently sidelined ‚Äî and was second best throughout the afternoon. Ludovic Blas put the hosts in front in the 24th minute and goals from Arnaud Kalimuendo and Albert Gronbaek completed the win. It was Rennes' second victory this season. Montpellier won the French league title once, in 2012, when it upset Paris Saint-Germain. Montpellier‚Äôs title-winning squad featured nine homegrown players, in contrast to PSG‚Äôs relentless pursuit of stars at the expense of its own youth academy. The club also won the second division title in 1987 and the French Cup in 1990 with a team featuring the likes of Eric Cantona, Laurent Blanc and Julio Cesar. PSG stayed in command at the top of the standings with a fourth win in as many games on Saturday. Ousmane DembeÃÅleÃÅ scored twice in the 3-1 win against Brest. PSG has a two-point lead at the top. title: CarolabruÃàcke in Dresden: Nach dem BruÃàckeneinsturz ist vor dem Hochwasser
creator: Thomas Baumann-Hartwig
content: Dresden kommt nicht zur Ruhe. Nach dem Einsturz an der CarolabruÃàcke am Mittwochmorgen erreicht ein schweres Elbehochwasser die Landeshauptstadt. Das Landeshochwasserzentrum Sachsen erwartet die hoÃàchsten PegelstaÃànde am Mittwoch und Donnerstag mit Werten bis zu 7 Meter, was der Alarmstufe 4 entspricht. Der Gro√üeinsatz an der CarolabruÃàcke ist beendet, der Katastrophenschutz arbeitet jetzt den Hochwasserabwehrplan ab, sagte Michael Katzsch, Amtsleiter Brand- und Katastrophenschutz, am Sonntagnachmittag. Der Abriss der TruÃàmmerteile der CarolabruÃàcke am NeustaÃàdter Elbufer sei von den beteiligten 13 Unternehmen sowie FeuerwehrkraÃàften, Ehrenamtlichen des Technischen Hilfswerks und Helfern der Bundeswehr planmaÃà√üig am Samstagabend abgeschlossen worden. ‚ÄûDas war eine Punktlandung.‚Äú Wegen des steigenden Elbpegels mussten die EinsatzkraÃàfte die Baustelle schon am Samstagabend beraÃàumen. Das Technische Hilfswerk hatte Betonplatten fuÃàr die SattelzuÃàge verlegt, die den TruÃàmmerschutt abtransportiert hatten und die wieder entfernt werden mussten. ‚ÄûWir haben weggeraÃàumt, was nur zu transportieren ging‚Äú, sagte der GeschaÃàftsfuÃàhrer der Firma Centro Umwelttechnik und Logistik GmbH Mathias Lindenlaub, der mit 12 Partnerunternehmen den Abriss gestemmt hatte.
